title: How do I stop mails being duplicated in a folder?
content:
SUMMARY

How do I stop mails being duplicated in a folder e.g. after moving a mail to that folder?

DETAIL

I've always had intermittent problems with Thunderbird duplicating every item in a folder. As it affects how I work, I've usually deleted the duplicates, which can be tedious, but overall the duplication's been at a manageable and tolerable level.

However recently - and I would definitely say since Supernova - it's happening regularly, and I'm getting tired of tidying and re-tidying folders.

From Properties, my Thunderbird folder is about 12gb with 3500 folders and 14500 files.

Please can anyone tell me what might cause duplication and the best ways of stopping it? Or, if it can't be stopped, is there an add-on which would delete the duplicates WITHIN a folder, but NOT ACROSS folders?

Thank you.

title: Mozzila Thunderbird email history import
content:
Hello,

Recently I have moved to a new PC device. I found out, that the Thunderbird messages were stored localy. Sadly I realized that too late. I only managed to recupared the .zip file with actual messages inside (inbox, sent, trash). I couldn't get back to get profile back-up etc., tried various solutions ... When I tried to import the messages only (through "tools") it stopped by 20% and some kind of error. Now I finaly managed to find the way: open from file - message ... and one by one opening each file (email). After that I go to "message" - "copy to folder" (i created one specialy for it). Than I go into that folder and: "move to" - inbox. That was the only way I could import the mails. But since its manual and each email, it takes forever ... also you can't select multiple files at once. Now my question is: is there any free faster way to do it? based on what I wrote above? I can handle do it all manualy, but I would be very glad to find some quicker solution

thank you in advance !

title: out going email, does not work
content:
I need to know the smtp settings to get the email outgoing to work. It just stopped working yesterday. It receives email, but will not send. talked to tech support at my provider, was told to contact you to solve this problem. To get started, make sure you have the following settings: 

   Username: Your full Spectrum email address 
   Password: Your Spectrum email password 
   SSL: On 
   Protocol: IMAP 
   Incoming Server Port: 993 
   Outgoing Server Port: 587 
   Requires Authentication: Yes, or checked

You'll also need to enter your incoming email server and outgoing email server. The server that allows you to send mail is the outgoing or SMTP server. The server that lets you receive mail is referred to as an incoming, POP or Mail server. Those will vary based on your domain, which is the part of your email address that follows the @ symbol, such as charter.net.

title: Thunderbird 115.5.1 (64-bit) on Kubuntu 22.04 will not display meeting invite times and dates
content:
I have been using Thunderbird for many years on Linux. Currently, my work has us connecting to Office365 and that is working well for sending and receiving email. I use Lightning 115.0 and TBSync 4.8 to manage the calendaring.

Something changed in the past month with one or more of the components or so so that I cannot see the date and time of a meeting. There used to be a tiny little downward arrow at the bottom of the message containing an invite that had the time and date as well as a button to accept the meeting. Now that is gone and all I get is the actual event weblinks or phone numbers, usually Teams, but sometimes other mechanisms. In all invites, I get no indication in the email of WHEN the event occurs.

If I open the message with the 'classic' reader, I get a window in a new tab that allows me to Get Appointment, that allows me to download the .ics file and I can import that back in, but that is extraordinarily annoying. Viewing normally as Original Html, but simple and text do the same thing. Example is attached.

Viewing source is not useful because it is some base64 mime encoding:

--_002_PH0PR84MB1408FAC958CBE3082C4F0FB5C68FAPH0PR84MB1408NAMP_ Content-Type: text/calendar; charset="utf-8"; method=REQUEST Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64

Is there some setting that will allow me to view the time and date of the invite without resorting to jumping through hoops, saving things to external files, and then bringing stuff back in?

If not, perhaps it is time to leave Thunderbird behind and just use Outlook PWA....
creator: rbeldin
